msbt.message: I've been waking up early to pack special lunches for myself. I put my food in fun little nested boxes. I mix up what I pack in them, but I always make sure to draw a funny face on my !
Aw, that's cute!
I'd pack sandwiches.
Don't forget a treat!

My dad did it for me when I was little, and I loved it so much then that I still do it now, .It's just so nice to open up my lunch and see it smiling back at me. That's a treat for my eyes and my tummy!
With the crusts cut off? I like using cookie cutters to cut my sandwiches into fun shapes, If you make sandwich wraps, you can cut them into cute little rolls!
I'd never forget to pack a treat!Cookies, a nice slice of cake, or even just a couple candies You can't go wrong, !
Freshly cleaned laundry smells great and it makes me feel great too!
That's why I make sure to wash my bath towel every day.
There are no words to describe the joy I feel when I'm burying my face in a soft, freshly washed towel.
Sometimes it's hard to make time, but it's worth doing for how good it feels when I dry off, !
The clean scent just relaxes me I feel a little calmer right now just imagining it, !
I bet I'd always get a good night's sleep as long as I was surrounded by the smell of clean laundry. That makes me wonder if I should try washing my sheets every day
If my bed smelled like that, maybe I'd dream I was running through fields of flowers,
I think that scent comes from drying my laundry outside in the fresh air and sunshine, .
Washing my sheets that much might turn out to be exhausting, though
Pop quiz! What do you think I'm thinking about right now?
Novels.
Picture books.
Poetry.
That's right! I was thinking about the one I was reading at bedtime just last night, ! I've read it before, but it's so good! It's the second book by the author of .
How'd you guess, ?I just picked up that best-selling one that's making everyone cry "The Tomato Ogre." I normally read books meant for grown-ups, but this one had me bawling my eyes out by the end
You're right, !I hope someday I can publish my own collection of poetryI've written lots of poems over the years, but I just don't feel like any of them are actually good yet.
Pop quiz! What do you think I'm thinking about right now?
Hats.
Socks.
Sweaters.
That's right! I just lost a hat that I'd knitted for myself, and I'm really going to miss it, . Each of my knit hats are tangled up with my favorite winter memories
That's right! One of my favorite magazines just did a great feature article about them, "What Your Socks Say About You" was the headline. Really makes you think, doesn't it?

That's right! I want to try to make some for myself, once I get better at knitting, . For now, I'm collecting sweater patterns I like whenever I see them in my magazinesOnce I can knit well enough, I'll have enough sweater patterns to fill out a whole new fall and winter wardrobe!
I felt like I was cooking the same things over and over, so I decided to try and mix things upThere are so many new recipes to try, and there's so much to remember. So I've been experimenting.
I found that setting a new recipe to music and singing it while I cook helps me remember it next time. It can get a little embarrassing if I get so carried away that my voice carries outside, .

I've tried taking pictures at every step of my cooking processI thought having the pictures might help me recreate any recipe that I'd decided I liked, . But I discovered that it falls apart if I forget to take a picture at any point in my process

It might sound silly, but moving around while I'm cooking seems to help me remember new recipes That way, I can get some exercise and learn how to cook new dishes at the same time, ! A few times I've had my leg cramp up mid-recipe, so maybe I should start stretching before I cook
You know what?

I can't get the ending of the novel I read yesterday out of my head.I usually enjoy happy endings, but this one didn't feel true to the story or the characters somehow. Being disappointed by any happy outcome is unlike me, .

I've been trying to plot out a novel of my own lately, and that's turning out to be harder than I expected. I know that I need my heroine to face hardship for my story to be interesting. That makes sense But I feel bad about having to make her feel bad. It's not in my nature to hurt anyone, .
I'm obsessing over a letter I found in my mailbox, with no return address or sender, Could it be from me, in the future? Just imagining that gets my heart racing!<10_4 /> So I haven't opened it yet.
